name: Le Macassar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from two lovely nights at Le Macassar. We were greeted by Ian and Miguel and sat down for a drink. Then we were shown to our room, although a little chilly, was absolutely lovely with a fantastic bathroom.
reviews.title: Beautiful Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were served breakfast at 11am when we came down. This was really great as most places serve breakfast at set times. The hot breakfast was absolutely delicious.
reviews.title: Loved every second

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have only stayed in two other hotels within this price range, with Le Macassar being right at the top of this range. One was a small guest house and the second was a Leading Hotel of the World chain. In both of these places, they had the turning of the bedsheets whilst we were out at dinner each night and the room was given a clean and toiletries refreshed twice per day (morning and evening). A tv in the room would also have been nice. These are the only reasons why I have not given Le Macassar 5/5.
reviews.title: No detail is overlooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were to visit the Somme area again then I would definitely book a room here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the fabulous reviews we thought , --- it can't be that good! Well how wrong could we have been. From the moment you enter the property, you get a wonderful welcome from Ian and Miguel,like meeting old friends.Having had a weekend that we won't forget for a very long time, we could not fault anything,at anytime,(Thanks you two,loved every second)
reviews.title: An Amazing Stay in Corbie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were fortunate to stay at Le Macassar in January this year. We arrived after a long day of travelling, tired and hungry. Ian greeted us at the gate and helped us with our luggage. After a welcoming glass of wine we felt very relaxed and comfortable, Miguel cooked us a superb restaurant quality meal that we throughly enjoyed before retiring to our fantastic suite for the night. Generally my husband and I do not sleep well, the bed was so comfy that we were sleeping in until 9am! Breakfast was another beautifully cooked meal. The area is great to visit and Le Macassar is in the perfect location for visiting the Somme Battlefields. Ian lent us a map and gave us some good suggestions on places to visit. It was like a home from home, very comfortable, lots of love to Spatz the dog and Sophie the cat!
reviews.title: Great Place to Visit

likes.liked: — Quality of rooms and friendly welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You must go there.
reviews.title: A lovely surprise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Le Macassar for two nights on a recent trip to the Somme area. What a delight! We were totally blown away by the hospitality shown by Ian and Miguel. Our room was beautifully decorated, spacious and extremely comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting, chatting and drinking with our hosts. Breakfast was amazing. So much to choose from and Miguel was happy to cook a hot addition as well. The local restaurants were a treat and the location of Corbie to all the war memorial monuments was excellent. Ian even loaned us some books and maps to help us make the most of our visit.
reviews.title: The eggs; you have to try the poached eggs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and Spats and Sophie and Cab were great fun.
reviews.title: Fantastic place
As good as it gets
reviews.text: If we are ever in the area again we will be sure to make a return visit. Highly recommended.

After a cancelled ferry and 2 hours arguing over car rental, we stood before the white front gates hoping (needing!) to find some respite. And we sure did. Ian took one look at us and promptly decided bags could wait in the car - first we must have a drink!
reviews.title: Art Deco Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 2 roooms over the hotel webiste (1 emperor suite for my parents and a superior room for my husband and I). Miguel was the consumate host and over several emails gave suggestions where my family and I might travel post Le Maccassar.
reviews.title: Nobody wants to leave !

reviews.text: The rooms are exquisite. From art deco interiors down to 'top shelf' bathroom products, the rooms were are a sanctuary. A tip - check out bathroom in the emperor suite. Special.
reviews.title: A Different Experience

likes.disliked: — Not a lot of the cultural things we like in Picardy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Agree with other reviews - the house part atmosphere is unrivalled. At least for me. Quick story... after returning from dinner (the bistro was a highlight of my entire trip. Have the snails), we returned to straight from the oven brownies. Miguel and Ian also indulged us in a cognac (or two!). What great fun.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I all agree that Le Macassar is simply the best hotel we have stayed in. And yes, we are all rather fussy!
reviews.title: A little gem!

likes.liked: — The faithful recreation of favourite periods of design and the relaxed atmosphere
likes.disliked: — we were happy to be there so had no adverse opinion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best properties we have stayed in over the past three years of our European travels. We stayed in a very large, beautifully decorated room done in shades of black and cream. The room had a sitting room, sleeping area and a very large bath. It was spotlessly clean and had numerous nice touches (candles, scented spray, etc.). The outside private patio was beautiful but weather did not cooperate so we did not get to sit out and enjoy it. We had a delicious breakfast each morning and were offered hot items from the kitchen to be cooked at our request (bacon, eggs, etc.). We had wonderful conversation with the other guests at breakfast and in the evenings over a glass (or more!) of wine. The best part of our stay was the owners, Miguel and Ian, who answered all our questions about local sites, recommended restaurants and made us feel like friends during our stay.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

reviews.text: Our stay at Le Macassar was one we will treasure for a long time. It's difficult to compare this jewel with other hotels as the owners, Ian and Miguel, have created a guest house that simply defies any pre-conception one my have of the term 'guest house' or B&B. Le Macassar combines opulent luxury with beautiful art deco furnishings brought alive by Ian and Miguel’s warm and welcoming personalities, coupled with their eye for attention to the smallest detail. I now understand how Le Macassar was awarded TripAdvisor’ Travellers’ Choice as the 2008 ‘Best Inn / B&B’ in the whole of France! James & Annette Power, Dorset, UK.
reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience

likes.liked: — The understated luxury of the establishment coupled with the owner's attention to every detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic place to stay! We have stayed in various luxury hotels, guest houses, etc. but this one ranks as the very best and our favourite. I know some reviews can go over the top but this one is well deserved. This was our second visit to le Macassar as a treat for my husbands’ birthday. The whole experience is second to none, the owners Ian and Miguel are the perfect hosts and made us feel extremely special for our whole stay (as I’m sure they do with every guest). They have worked hard at creating a unique experience and you honestly feel like you are staying with friends rather than a hotel.
reviews.title: a unique place to stay

likes.liked: — art deco style and the hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are avid Art Deco fans and le Macassar is a real treat for us as they have captured the style beautifully - got the deco bug even more now!. Miguel kindly showed us around all the bedrooms on our last visit and they are all stunning and individually styled. Although for us the highlight is the deco suite which we would recommend indulging in as this is absolutely fabulous and very decadent, especially the huge free standing bath plus the most comfortable bed in France! Breakfast is perfect ranging from local cheeses, pastries etc.. to freshly prepared fruit and yogurts - try the honey it's delicious. There is a lovely courtyard garden to relax in with a glass of vino or two (or three!) on a sunny evening. There are some good local places to eat in Corbie although we ate in the near by village of Bonnay the second night which was excellent. We were joined by Ian and Miguel (who actually offered to drive us there and back) and another couple of guests, which turned out to be a really great night with lots of wine and good food and company. Also in terms of the area Corbie is a great location for visiting the Great War memorials and battlefields as you are slap bang in the middle of the Somme sector with Albert, Thiepval, Villers-Bretonneux, Serre, La Boisselle, Devil’s Wood and Pozieres all within an easy 25 minute drive.
reviews.title: Wonderful Le Macassar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So as you can tell we would highly recommend this as a wonderful place to stay for a relaxed, informal and unique experience …so don’t miss out!
reviews.title: A unique place

description: Restored in 1926, Le Macassar boasts unique art deco and art nouveau interiors alongside traditional 18th-century rooms providing a perfect backdrop for the owners' collection of period art and antiques. Only 15 minutes away from Amiens we are ideally located for visiting the memorials to the First World War and most major sites (Thiepval, Beaumont Hamel)are within 30 minutes drive. The main Australian WW1 Memorial near Villers Bretonneux is less than 5 minutes away, Vimy Ridge about 50 minutes drive. Guests return again and again to enjoy the service of a luxury hotel together with the relaxation and informality of a private home. For breakfast, an indulgent selection of homemade and local produce is served at a time to suit you and not ourselves!
